title: Chronicles of the Canongate, 1st Series
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'There is thepuir Highland creatures frae Glenshee, that cam down for the harvest,and are lying wi' the fever--five shillings to them; and half a crown toBessie MacEvoy, whose coodman, puir creature, died of the frost, beinga shairman, for a' the whisky he could drink to keep it out o' hisstamoch; and--"

title: Noctes ambrosianæ,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: A strong body of Celts, collected among the mountains towards the Spitta'l of Glenshee, advanced, with a most hostile demonstration, to the tent, and demanded 20 for the slaughter committed among their flocks by the outlandish dogs of the four English Gentlemen.

title: John Splendid;
author: Munro, Neil
snippet: (My heart still at tether in bonny Glenshee), Weary the marches made, sad the towns harried O,

title: The history of a man.
author: Gilfillan, George
snippet: of Glenshee, in the morning of a fine warm June day ; had
